get.description:
Retrieve a list of all permissions available to the current access token.

The results are **not** paginated.

200.description: A list of permission objects. For a complete reference of the permission object, refer to the [Get permission endpoint](get-permission) documentation.

count.description:
The number of items in this result set. If more items are available, a `_links.next` URL will be present in the result as well.

The maximum number of items per result set is controlled by the `limit` property provided in the request. The default limit is 50 items.

permissions.description: An array of permission objects. For a complete reference of the permission object, refer to the [Get permission endpoint](get-permission) documentation.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: The URL to the current set of items.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

400.description: The request contains issues. For example, if the specified `from` value is not a valid ID.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/permissions \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$permissions = $mollie->permissions->all();

from mollie.api.client import Client

mollie_client = Client()
mollie_client.set_access_token("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ")

permissions = mollie_client.permissions.list()

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

permissions = Mollie::Permission.all

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Provide the ID of the item you want to perform this operation on.

get.description: Retrieve a single permission by its ID, and see if the permission is granted to the current access token.

parameters.name: testmode
parameters.description:
Most API credentials are specifically created for either live mode or test mode. In those cases the `testmode` query parameter can be omitted. For organization-level credentials such as OAuth access tokens, you can enable test mode by setting the `testmode` query parameter to `true`.

Test entities cannot be retrieved when the endpoint is set to live mode, and vice versa.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a permission object. Will always contain the string `permission` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this permission. Example: `payments.read`.

description.description: A short description of what kind of access the permission enables.

granted.description: Whether this permission is granted to the app by the organization.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/permissions/payments.read \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$permission = $mollie->permissions->get("payments.read");

from mollie.api.client import Client

mollie_client = Client()
mollie_client.set_access_token("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ")

permission = mollie_client.permissions.get("payments.read")

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

permission = Mollie::Permission.get('payments.read')

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Provide the ID of the item you want to perform this operation on.

get.description:
Retrieve a single organization by its ID.

You can normally only retrieve the currently authenticated organization with this endpoint. This is primarily useful for OAuth apps. See also [Get current organization](get-current-organization).

If you have a *partner account*', you can retrieve organization details of connected organizations.

parameters.name: testmode
parameters.description:
Most API credentials are specifically created for either live mode or test mode. In those cases the `testmode` query parameter can be omitted. For organization-level credentials such as OAuth access tokens, you can enable test mode by setting the `testmode` query parameter to `true`.

Test entities cannot be retrieved when the endpoint is set to live mode, and vice versa.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains an organization object. Will always contain the string `organization` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this organization. Example: `org_12345678`.

email.description: The email address associated with the organization.

locale.description: The preferred locale of the merchant, as set in their Mollie dashboard.

title.description: The title of the person, for example *Mr.* or *Mrs.*.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

familyName.description: The given family name (surname) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization, in case the addressee is an organization.

streetAdditional.description: Any additional addressing details, for example an apartment number.

postalCode.description: A postal code. This field may be required if the provided country has a postal code system.

phone.description: If provided, it must be in the [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format. For example: +31208202070.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description:
The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union or in The United Kingdom. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

The field is not present for merchants residing in other countries.

vatRegulation.description:
Mollie applies Dutch VAT for merchants based in The Netherlands, British VAT for merchants based in The United Kingdom, and shifted VAT for merchants in the European Union.

The field is not present for merchants residing in other countries.

Possible values: `dutch` `british` `shifted`

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

dashboard.description: Direct link to the organization's Mollie dashboard.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/organizations/org_12345678 \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$organization = $mollie->organizations->get("org_12345678");

/*

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'

get.description:
Retrieve the currently authenticated organization. A convenient alias of the [Get organization](get-organization) endpoint.

For a complete reference of the organization object, refer to the [Get organization](get-organization) endpoint documentation.

200.description: The current organization object. For a complete reference of the organization object, refer to the [Get organization](get-organization) endpoint documentation.

code-samples.code:
curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/organizations/me \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$organization = $mollie->organizations->current();

get.description: Retrieve partnership details about the currently authenticated organization. Only relevant for so-called *partner accounts*.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a partner status object. Will always contain the string `partner` for this endpoint.

partnerType.description:
Indicates the type of partner. Will be `null` if the currently authenticated organization is not enrolled as a partner.

Possible values: `oauth` `signuplink` `useragent`

isCommissionPartner.description: Whether the current organization is receiving commissions.

userAgentTokens.description: Array of User-Agent token objects. Present if the organization is a partner of type `useragent`, or if they were in the past.

startsAt.description: The date from which the token is active, in ISO 8601 format.

endsAt.description: The date until when the token will be active, in ISO 8601 format. Will be `null` if the token does not have an end date (yet).

partnerContractSignedAt.description: The date the partner contract was signed, in ISO 8601 format. Omitted if no contract has been signed (yet).

partnerContractUpdateAvailable.description: Whether an update to the partner contract is available and requiring the organization's agreement.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

signuplink.description: The URL that can be used to have new organizations sign up and be automatically linked to this partner. Will be omitted if the partner is not of type `signuplink`.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/organizations/me/partner \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'

post.description:
Create a profile to process payments on.

Profiles are required for payment processing. Normally they are created via the Mollie dashboard. Alternatively, you can use this endpoint to automate profile creation.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a profile object. Will always contain the string `profile` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this profile. Example: `pfl_v9hTwCvYqw`.

mode.description:
Whether this entity was created in live mode or in test mode.

Possible values: `live` `test`

name.description: The profile's name, this will usually reflect the trade name or brand name of the profile's website or application.

website.description: The URL to the profile's website or application. Only `https` or `http` URLs are allowed. No `@` signs are allowed.

email.description: The email address associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

phone.description: The phone number associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

description.description: The products or services offered by the profile's website or application.

countriesOfActivity.description: A list of countries where you expect that the majority of the profile's customers reside, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

businessCategory.description: The industry associated with the profile's trade name or brand. Please refer to the [business category list](business-categories) for all possible options.

status.description:
The profile status determines whether the profile is able to receive live payments.

Possible values:

* `unverified`: The profile has not been verified yet and can only be used to create test payments.
* `verified`: The profile has been verified and can be used to create live payments and test payments.
* `blocked`: The profile is blocked and can no longer be used or changed.

review.description: Present if changes have been made that have not yet been approved by Mollie. Changes to test profiles are approved automatically, unless a switch to a live profile has been requested. The review object will therefore usually be `null` in test mode.

status.description:
The status of the requested changes.

Possible values: `pending` `rejected`

createdAt.description: The entity's date and time of creation, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

dashboard.description: Link to the profile in the Mollie dashboard.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

chargebacks.description: The API resource URL of the chargebacks that belong to this profile.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

methods.description: The API resource URL of the methods that are enabled for this profile.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

payments.description: The API resource URL of the payments that belong to this profile.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

refunds.description: The API resource URL of the refunds that belong to this profile.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

checkoutPreviewUrl.description: The hosted checkout preview URL. You need to be logged in to access this page.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

201.description: The newly created profile object. For a complete reference of the profile object, refer to the [Get profile endpoint](get-profile) documentation.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X POST https://api.mollie.com/v2/profiles \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ" \
    -d "name=My website name" \
    -d "website=https://shop.example.org" \
    -d "email=info@example.org" \
    -d "phone=+31208202070" \
    -d "businessCategory=OTHER_MERCHANDISE" \
    -d "mode=live"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$profile = $mollie->profiles->create([
    "name" => "My website name",
    "website" => "https://shop.example.org",
    "email" => "info@example.org",
    "phone" => "+31208202070",
    "businessCategory" => "OTHER_MERCHANDISE",
    "mode" => "live",
]);

from mollie.api.client import Client

mollie_client = Client()
mollie_client.set_access_token("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ")

profile = mollie_client.profiles.create({
    "name": "My website name",
    "website": "https://shop.example.org",
    "email": "info@example.org",
    "phone": "+31208202070",
    "businessCategory": "OTHER_MERCHANDISE",
    "mode": "live",
})

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

profile = Mollie::Profile.create(
  name: 'My website name',
  website: 'https://shop.example.org',
  email: 'info@example.org',
  phone: '+31208202070',
  businessCategory: 'OTHER_MERCHANDISE',
  mode: 'live'
)

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all of your profiles.

The results are paginated.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Provide an ID to start the result set from the item with the given ID and onwards. This allows you to paginate the result set.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 50 items.

200.description: A list of profile objects. For a complete reference of the profile object, refer to the [Get profile endpoint](get-profile) documentation.

count.description:
The number of items in this result set. If more items are available, a `_links.next` URL will be present in the result as well.

The maximum number of items per result set is controlled by the `limit` property provided in the request. The default limit is 50 items.

profiles.description: An array of profile objects. For a complete reference of the profile object, refer to the [Get profile endpoint](get-profile) documentation.

_links.description: Links to help navigate through the lists of items. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: The URL to the current set of items.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

previous.description: The previous set of items, if available.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

next.description: The next set of items, if available.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

400.description: The request contains issues. For example, if the specified `from` value is not a valid ID.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X GET https://api.mollie.com/v2/profiles \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$profiles = $mollie->profiles();

from mollie.api.client import Client

mollie_client = Client()
mollie_client.set_access_token("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ")

profiles = mollie_client.profiles.list()

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

profiles = Mollie::Profile.all

parameters.description:
Most API credentials are specifically created for either live mode or test mode. In those cases the `testmode` query parameter can be omitted. For organization-level credentials such as OAuth access tokens, you can enable test mode by setting the `testmode` query parameter to `true`.

Test entities cannot be retrieved when the endpoint is set to live mode, and vice versa.

patch.description:
Update an existing profile.

Profiles are required for payment processing. Normally they are created and updated via the Mollie dashboard. Alternatively, you can use this endpoint to automate profile management.

mode.description: Updating a profile from `test` mode to `live` mode will trigger a verification process, where we review the profile before it can start accepting payments.

200.description: The updated profile object. For a complete reference of the profile object, refer to the [Get profile endpoint](get-profile) documentation.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

code-samples.code:
curl -X PATCH https://api.mollie.com/v2/profiles/pfl_QkEhN94Ba \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ" \
    -d "name=My updated website name" \
    -d "website=https://updated.example.org"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$mollie->profiles->update("pfl_QkEhN94Ba", [
    "name" => "My updated website name",
    "website" => "https://updated.example.org",
]);

from mollie.api.client import Client

mollie_client = Client()
mollie_client.set_api_key("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ")

profile = mollie_client.profiles.update("pfl_QkEhN94Ba", {
    "name": "My updated website name",
    "website": "https://updated.example.org"
})

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

profile = Mollie::profile.update(
  'pfl_QkEhN94Ba',
  name: 'My updated website name',
  website: 'https://updated.example.org'
)

get.description: Retrieve the onboarding status of the currently authenticated organization.

200.description: The onboarding status object of the current organization.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains an onboarding status object. Will always contain the string `onboarding` for this endpoint.

status.description:
The current status of the organization's onboarding process.

Possible values:
* `needs-data`  The merchant needs to provide additional information
* `in-review`  The merchant provided all information, awaiting review from Mollie
* `completed`  The onboarding is completed

canReceivePayments.description: Whether the organization can receive payments.

canReceiveSettlements.description: Whether the organization can receive settlements to their external bank account.

signedUpAt.description: The sign up date of the organization.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

dashboard.description: Direct link to the onboarding process in the Mollie dashboard. The merchant can be redirected to this page to complete their onboarding.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

organization.description: The API resource URL of the organization.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

post.description:
** We no longer recommend implementing this endpoint. Please refer to the Client Links API instead to kick off the onboarding process for your merchants.**

Submit data that will be prefilled in the merchant's onboarding. The data you submit will only be processed when the onboarding status is `needs-data`. Information that the merchant has entered in their dashboard will not be overwritten.

title.description: The title of the person, for example *Mr.* or *Mrs.*.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

familyName.description: The given family name (surname) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization, in case the addressee is an organization.

streetAdditional.description: Any additional addressing details, for example an apartment number.

postalCode.description: A postal code. This field may be required if the provided country has a postal code system.

phone.description: If provided, it must be in the [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format. For example: +31208202070.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description:
The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union or in The United Kingdom. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

The field can be omitted for merchants residing in other countries.

vatRegulation.description:
Mollie applies Dutch VAT for merchants based in The Netherlands, British VAT for merchants based in The United Kingdom, and shifted VAT for merchants in the European Union.

The field can be omitted for merchants residing in other countries.

Possible values: `dutch` `british` `shifted`

name.description: The profile's name, this will usually reflect the trade name or brand name of the profile's website or application.

website.description: The URL to the profile's website or application. Only `https` or `http` URLs are allowed. No `@` signs are allowed.

email.description: The email address associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

phone.description: The phone number associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

description.description: The products or services offered by the profile's website or application.

businessCategory.description: The industry associated with the profile's trade name or brand. Please refer to the [business category list](business-categories) for all possible options.

code-samples.code:
curl -X POST https://api.mollie.com/v2/onboarding/me \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer live_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM" \
    -d "organization[name]=Mollie B.V." \
    -d "organization[address][streetAndNumber]=Keizersgracht 126" \
    -d "organization[address][postalCode]=1015 CW" \
    -d "organization[address][city]=Amsterdam" \
    -d "organization[address][country]=NL" \
    -d "organization[registrationNumber]=30204462" \
    -d "organization[vatNumber]=NL815839091B01" \
    -d "profile[name]=Mollie" \
    -d "profile[url]=https://www.mollie.com" \
    -d "profile[email]=info@mollie.com" \
    -d "profile[phone]=+31208202070" \
    -d "profile[businessCategory]=MONEY_SERVICES"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$mollie->onboarding->submit([
    "organization" => [
        "name" => "Mollie B.V.",
        "address" => [
            "streetAndNumber" => "Keizersgracht 126",
            "postalCode" => "1015 CW",
            "city" => "Amsterdam",
            "country" => "NL",
        ],
        "registrationNumber" => "30204462",
        "vatNumber" => "NL815839091B01",
    ],
    "profile" => [
        "name" => "Mollie",
        "url" => "https://www.mollie.com",
        "email" => "info@mollie.com",
        "phone" => "+31208202070",
        "businessCategory": "MONEY_SERVICES",
    ],
]);

/*
We don't have a Node.js code example for this
API call yet.

If you have some time to spare, feel free to
share suggestions on our Discord:
https://discord.gg/VaTVkXB4aQ
*/

require 'mollie-api-ruby'

Mollie::Client.configure do |config|
  config.api_key = 'access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ'
end

Mollie::Onboarding.submit(
  organization: {
    name: "Mollie B.V.",
    address: {
      streetAndNumber: "Keizersgracht 126",
      postalCode: "1015 CW",
      city: "Amsterdam",
      country: "NL"
    },
    registrationNumber: "30204462",
    vatNumber: "NL815839091B01"
  },
  profile: {
    name: "Mollie",
    url: "https://www.mollie.com",
    email: "info@mollie.com",
    phone: "+31208202070",
    businessCategory: "MONEY_SERVICES"
  }
)

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all clients linked to your account.

The results are paginated.

parameters.description:
This endpoint allows embedding related API items by appending the following values via the `embed` query string parameter.

* `organization`: Include the organization of the client. Available for `signuplink` partners, or for `oauth` partners with the `organizations.read` scope.
* `onboarding`: Include the onboarding status of the client. Available for `signuplink` partners, or for `oauth` partners with the `onboarding.read` scope.
parameters.name: embed
from
parameters.description: Provide an ID to start the result set from the item with the given ID and onwards. This allows you to paginate the result set.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 50 items.

200.description: A list of client objects. For a complete reference of the client object, refer to the [Get client endpoint](get-client) documentation.

count.description:
The number of items in this result set. If more items are available, a `_links.next` URL will be present in the result as well.

The maximum number of items per result set is controlled by the `limit` property provided in the request. The default limit is 50 items.

clients.description: An array of client objects. For a complete reference of the client object, refer to the [Get client endpoint](get-client) documentation.

_links.description: Links to help navigate through the lists of items. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: The URL to the current set of items.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

previous.description: The previous set of items, if available.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

next.description: The next set of items, if available.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

400.description: The request contains issues. For example, if the specified `from` value is not a valid ID.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

404.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ"

<?php
$mollie = new \Mollie\Api\MollieApiClient();
$mollie->setAccessToken("access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ");

$clients = $mollie->clients();

get.description: Retrieve a single client by its ID.

parameters.description:
This endpoint allows embedding related API items by appending the following values via the `embed` query string parameter.

* `organization`: Include the organization of the client. Available for `signuplink` partners, or for `oauth` partners with the `organizations.read` scope.
* `onboarding`: Include the onboarding status of the client. Available for `signuplink` partners, or for `oauth` partners with the `onboarding.read` scope.
parameters.name: embed

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a client object. Will always contain the string `client` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this client. Example: `org_12345678`.

organizationCreatedAt.description: The date and time the client organization was created, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

post.description:
>  Closed beta
> 
> The Client Links API is in closed beta and only available to selected partners. Please contact your partner manager if you want to implement this.

Link a new or existing organization to your OAuth application, in effect creating a new client. The response contains a `clientLink` where you should redirect your customer to.

The `clientLink` URL behaves similar to the regular OAuth authorization URL. It supports the following parameters from the [Authorize](authorize) endpoint:

* `client_id`
* `state`
* `approval_prompt`
* `scope`

We recommend at least requesting the scopes `onboarding.read onboarding.write` this way.

Error handling is also dealt with similar to the [Authorize](authorize) endpoint: the customer is redirected back to your app's redirect URL with the `error` and `error_description` parameters added to the URL.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a client link object. Will always contain the string `client-link` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this client link. Example: `cl_vZCnNQsV2UtfXxYifWKWH`.

email.description: The email address of your customer.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of your customer.

familyName.description: The family name (surname) of your customer.

locale.description:
Preset the language to be used for the login screen, if applicable. For the consent screen, the preferred language of the logged in merchant will be used and this parameter is ignored.

When this parameter is omitted, the browser language will be used instead.

Possible values: `en_US` `nl_NL` `nl_BE` `fr_FR` `fr_BE` `de_DE` `es_ES` `it_IT`

streetAndNumber.description: The street name and house number of the organization.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the organization. Required if a street address is provided and if the country has a postal code system.

city.description: The city of the organization. Required if a street address is provided.

country.description: The country of the address in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description: The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

clientLink.description: The link you can send your customer to, where they can either log in and link their account, or sign up and proceed with onboarding.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

201.description: The newly created client link object.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a client link object. Will always contain the string `client-link` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this client link. Example: `cl_vZCnNQsV2UtfXxYifWKWH`.

email.description: The email address of your customer.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of your customer.

familyName.description: The family name (surname) of your customer.

locale.description:
Preset the language to be used for the login screen, if applicable. For the consent screen, the preferred language of the logged in merchant will be used and this parameter is ignored.

When this parameter is omitted, the browser language will be used instead.

Possible values: `en_US` `nl_NL` `nl_BE` `fr_FR` `fr_BE` `de_DE` `es_ES` `it_IT`

streetAndNumber.description: The street name and house number of the organization.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the organization. Required if a street address is provided and if the country has a postal code system.

city.description: The city of the organization. Required if a street address is provided.

country.description: The country of the address in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description: The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

clientLink.description: The link you can send your customer to, where they can either log in and link their account, or sign up and proceed with onboarding.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

curl -X POST https://api.mollie.com/v2/client-links \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer access_Wwvu7egPcJLLJ9Kb7J632x8wJ2zMeJ" \
    -d "owner[email]=info@example.org" \
    -d "owner[givenName]=Chuck" \
    -d "owner[familyName]=Norris" \
    -d "address[country]=NL" \
    -d "name=Mollie B.V." \
    -d "registrationNumber=30204462" \
    -d "vatNumber=NL815839091B01"

list-count.description:
The number of items in this result set. If more items are available, a `_links.next` URL will be present in the result as well.

The maximum number of items per result set is controlled by the `limit` property provided in the request. The default limit is 50 items.

url.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a permission object. Will always contain the string `permission` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this permission. Example: `payments.read`.

description.description: A short description of what kind of access the permission enables.

granted.description: Whether this permission is granted to the app by the organization.

_links.description: An object with several relevant URLs. Every URL object will contain an `href` and a `type` field.

self.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

documentation.description: In v2 endpoints, URLs are commonly represented as objects with an `href` and `type` field.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

title.description: The title of the person, for example *Mr.* or *Mrs.*.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

familyName.description: The given family name (surname) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization, in case the addressee is an organization.

streetAdditional.description: Any additional addressing details, for example an apartment number.

postalCode.description: A postal code. This field may be required if the provided country has a postal code system.

phone.description: If provided, it must be in the [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format. For example: +31208202070.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains an organization object. Will always contain the string `organization` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this organization. Example: `org_12345678`.

email.description: The email address associated with the organization.

locale.description: The preferred locale of the merchant, as set in their Mollie dashboard.

title.description: The title of the person, for example *Mr.* or *Mrs.*.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

familyName.description: The given family name (surname) of the person should be at least two characters and cannot contain only numbers.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization, in case the addressee is an organization.

streetAdditional.description: Any additional addressing details, for example an apartment number.

postalCode.description: A postal code. This field may be required if the provided country has a postal code system.

phone.description: If provided, it must be in the [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format. For example: +31208202070.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description:
The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union or in The United Kingdom. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

The field is not present for merchants residing in other countries.

vatRegulation.description:
Mollie applies Dutch VAT for merchants based in The Netherlands, British VAT for merchants based in The United Kingdom, and shifted VAT for merchants in the European Union.

The field is not present for merchants residing in other countries.

Possible values: `dutch` `british` `shifted`

previous.description: The previous set of items, if available.

type.description: The content type of the page or endpoint the URL points to.

mode.description:
Whether this entity was created in live mode or in test mode.

Possible values: `live` `test`

created-at.description: The entity's date and time of creation, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains a profile object. Will always contain the string `profile` for this endpoint.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this profile. Example: `pfl_v9hTwCvYqw`.

mode.description:
Whether this entity was created in live mode or in test mode.

Possible values: `live` `test`

name.description: The profile's name, this will usually reflect the trade name or brand name of the profile's website or application.

website.description: The URL to the profile's website or application. Only `https` or `http` URLs are allowed. No `@` signs are allowed.

email.description: The email address associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

phone.description: The phone number associated with the profile's trade name or brand.

description.description: The products or services offered by the profile's website or application.

countriesOfActivity.description: A list of countries where you expect that the majority of the profile's customers reside, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

businessCategory.description: The industry associated with the profile's trade name or brand. Please refer to the [business category list](business-categories) for all possible options.

status.description:
The profile status determines whether the profile is able to receive live payments.

Possible values:

* `unverified`: The profile has not been verified yet and can only be used to create test payments.
* `verified`: The profile has been verified and can be used to create live payments and test payments.
* `blocked`: The profile is blocked and can no longer be used or changed.

review.description: Present if changes have been made that have not yet been approved by Mollie. Changes to test profiles are approved automatically, unless a switch to a live profile has been requested. The review object will therefore usually be `null` in test mode.

status.description:
The status of the requested changes.

Possible values: `pending` `rejected`

createdAt.description: The entity's date and time of creation, in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

refunds.description: The API resource URL of the refunds that belong to this profile.

checkoutPreviewUrl.description: The hosted checkout preview URL. You need to be logged in to access this page.

resource.description: Indicates the response contains an onboarding status object. Will always contain the string `onboarding` for this endpoint.

status.description:
The current status of the organization's onboarding process.

Possible values:
* `needs-data`  The merchant needs to provide additional information
* `in-review`  The merchant provided all information, awaiting review from Mollie
* `completed`  The onboarding is completed

canReceivePayments.description: Whether the organization can receive payments.

canReceiveSettlements.description: Whether the organization can receive settlements to their external bank account.

signedUpAt.description: The sign up date of the organization.

id.description: The identifier uniquely referring to this client link. Example: `cl_vZCnNQsV2UtfXxYifWKWH`.

email.description: The email address of your customer.

givenName.description: The given name (first name) of your customer.

familyName.description: The family name (surname) of your customer.

locale.description:
Preset the language to be used for the login screen, if applicable. For the consent screen, the preferred language of the logged in merchant will be used and this parameter is ignored.

When this parameter is omitted, the browser language will be used instead.

Possible values: `en_US` `nl_NL` `nl_BE` `fr_FR` `fr_BE` `de_DE` `es_ES` `it_IT`

streetAndNumber.description: The street name and house number of the organization.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the organization. Required if a street address is provided and if the country has a postal code system.

city.description: The city of the organization. Required if a street address is provided.

country.description: The country of the address in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

registrationNumber.description: The registration number of the organization at their local chamber of commerce.

vatNumber.description: The VAT number of the organization, if based in the European Union. VAT numbers are verified against the international registry *VIES*.

400-invalid-list-request.description: The request contains issues. For example, if the specified `from` value is not a valid ID.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

documentation.description: The URL to the generic Mollie API error handling guide.

404-invalid-id.description: No entity with this ID exists.

status.description: The status code of the error message. This is always the same code as the status code of the HTTP message itself.

title.description: The HTTP reason phrase of the error. For example, for a `404` error, the `title` will be `Not Found`.

detail.description: A detailed human-readable description of the error that occurred.

field.description: If the error was caused by a value provided by you in a specific field, the `field` property will contain the name of the field that caused the issue.

id.name: id
id.description: Provide the ID of the item you want to perform this operation on.

testmode.name: testmode
testmode.description:
Most API credentials are specifically created for either live mode or test mode. In those cases the `testmode` query parameter can be omitted. For organization-level credentials such as OAuth access tokens, you can enable test mode by setting the `testmode` query parameter to `true`.

Test entities cannot be retrieved when the endpoint is set to live mode, and vice versa.

list-from.name: from
list-from.description: Provide an ID to start the result set from the item with the given ID and onwards. This allows you to paginate the result set.

list-limit.name: limit
list-limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 50 items.

embed.name: embed
embed.description: This endpoint allows embedding related API items by appending the following values via the `embed` query string parameter.
